trans-unit.source: Specifies a set of standard access rights that correspond to operations common to most types of securable objects.
The StandardAccessRights class provides access rights for common operations, such as deleting, reading, and writing.
The precise meaning of each member is specific to the object type to which it is applied.
StandardAccessRights is one of two enumerations to which the <xref:System.Messaging.GenericAccessRights> enumeration maps extensive read, write, or execute abilities.
StandardAccessRights enables you to specify rights common to most objects, for example, deleting the object or reading a security descriptor.
Both StandardAccessRights and <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueueAccessRights> provide a member for deleting a queue.
The needs of the application define which set of flags you use.

Combines <xref uid="langword_csharp_Delete" name="Delete" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_ReadSecurity" name="ReadSecurity" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_WriteSecurity" name="WriteSecurity" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_ModifyOwner" name="ModifyOwner" href=""></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_Synchronize" name="Synchronize" href=""></xref> access.
To be added.
The right to delete the object.
To be added.
The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor.
On Windows 2000 and Windows NT, the security descriptor contains the security information for a securable object.
It identifies the object's owner and primary group.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_Execute" name="Execute" href=""></xref> is currently defined to equal <xref uid="langword_csharp_ReadSecurity" name="ReadSecurity" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
The right to change the owner in the object's security descriptor.
To be added.
No access.
To be added.
The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_Read" name="Read" href=""></xref> is currently defined to equal <xref uid="langword_csharp_ReadSecurity" name="ReadSecurity" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor.
To be added.

Combines <xref uid="langword_csharp_Delete" name="Delete" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_ReadSecurity" name="ReadSecurity" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_WriteSecurity" name="WriteSecurity" href=""></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_ModifyOwner" name="ModifyOwner" href=""></xref> access.
To be added.
The right to use the object for synchronization.
This enables a thread to wait until the object is in a specific state.
To be added.
The right to read the information in the object's security descriptor.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_Write" name="Write" href=""></xref> is currently defined to equal <xref uid="langword_csharp_ReadSecurity" name="ReadSecurity" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
The right to modify the discretionary access control list (DACL) in the security descriptor.
The DACL controls access to the object.
Being able to write to the DACL gives the user the ability to set security for the object.
To be added.
